oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Tintype of unidentified member of the 13th Tenn. Cav. Regt., USA
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This unidentified soldier was part of a larger collection of images of members of the 13th Tenn. Cav. Regt., USA. The original tintype has been hand tinted provide color to his checks, vest, buttons, and watch fab. He is wearing a US mounted services jaceket over his sky blue military style vest. The 13th Tenn. Cav. Regt., USA hailed primarily from upper East Tennessee . The regiment became part of the Governor's Guard and surrounded and killed Confederate General John Hunt Morgan in September, 1864.
